comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: Here is a silent industrial documentary film which shows how this main arch decking and troughing was turned into a roadway surface: aso.gov.au/titles/documentaries/construction-sydney-harbo...

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: The height of the left pair of tunnels there looks quite strange,   they were actually below the road level.  They must have added a lot more fill to the road further along before they finished it.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy] Thanks for adding that link to the movie, it's very interesting.

AB

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content:
mich, the roadway kicks up significantly at the point where that decking in the picture ends, always has been so to allow the tunnels to curve under the roadway as they head towards Wynyard.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/5578135928/in/photostream/]
